title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
સર્વે મળી હવે સાંભળો, અતિ વાત કહું અનુપ<RHYME_209154>; 
હરિ ઉપાસી જનને, છે સાંભળતાં સુખરૂપ<RHYME_209154>.
gujarati.context: Gather around now and listen carefully, I'll tell you a wonderful tale; For those who worship God, there is eternal bliss and happiness.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ચર્ણે ચર્ણે ચરિત્ર ચવ્યાં, કૃષ્ણદેવનાં બહુ બહુ; 
અમૃતવત કથા એહ, સદમતિ સુણશે સહુ.
gujarati.context: The character of Lord Krishna is cherished and devoured, many times over; this story of immortality will forever be remembered by the wise.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
વચન છે ધર્મદેવનાં, પુત્ર પ્રત્યે પરમાણ<RHYME_209156>; 
શ્રવણ દઈ જે સાંભળે, તે પામે પદ નિરવાણ<RHYME_209156>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The divine principles are guidelines for parents, measuring their sons' worth; if you listen to your son's words, you will reach destruction.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ધર્મે સુત તેડાવિયા, દેવા શિખામણ સુખકાજ<RHYME_209158>; 
અંત સમે નિધિ આપવા, ઇછ્યા આપે મહારાજ<RHYME_209158>.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that one should seek spiritual growth and happiness through devotion to God, rather than material wealth or worldly possessions. Ultimately, it is the divine that provides true fulfillment and prosperity.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી તેડાવિયા સુત દોય<RHYME_209159>, આવી બેઠા વંદન કરી સોય<RHYME_209159>; 
જ્યારે પુત્ર લાગ્યા આવી પાય<RHYME_209159>, તેહ પ્રત્યે બોલ્યા ધર્મરાય<RHYME_209159>.
gujarati.context:
When troubles pass, sit down and calm down; pray with devotion in the presence of God.
At that moment, my son fell ill, and I called out to Lord Dharmaraya.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
હે પુત્ર તમે મારું વચન<RHYME_209160>, હિતકારી છે માનજ્યો મન<RHYME_209160>; 
કહું રહસ્ય તણી વાત એહ<RHYME_209161>, ધારો હૃદયમાં કરી સ્નેહ<RHYME_209161>.
gujarati.context: The child, listen to my words of wisdom, may they be beneficial and cherished in your heart; I'm sharing a secret with you, keep it in your heart and nurture love.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
મારા વચન માંહિ પ્રતીત<RHYME_209162>, હોય તો તમે ધારજ્યો ચિત<RHYME_209162>; 
ત્યારે કર જોડી કહે બેઉ ભ્રાત<RHYME_209162>, અમે માનશું કહો તમે તાત<RHYME_209162>.
gujarati.context:
My words are in your mind, you will remember; 
When I'll depart, let others call you brother, but you be a man of your own heart.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
જે જે કહેશો આ સમે વચન<RHYME_209160>, તે તે સત્ય માનવાં છે મન<RHYME_209160>; 
ત્યારે ધર્મ કહે સુત શ્રેષ્ઠ, રાધાકૃષ્ણ જે આપણા ઇષ્ટ.
gujarati.context: What is spoken in the present moment is considered true; when it comes to matters of faith, we consider Radha-Krishna as our ultimate ideal.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
જેને ઉપાસું છું આઠું જામ<RHYME_209163>, તે જ કૃષ્ણ આ શ્રીહરિ નામ<RHYME_209163>; 
મારા સુત ને તમારા ભાઈ<RHYME_209164>, તે છે કૃષ્ણ માનો મન માંઈ<RHYME_209164>.
gujarati.context: I am devoted to Krishna's name, which is equivalent to the eightfold worship; consider my brother as your brother and have faith in God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિરૂપ આ કૃષ્ણ સાક્ષાત્, તેની ભક્તિ કરજ્યો બે ભ્રાત<RHYME_209162>; 
રહેજ્યો એના વચનમાં નિત્ય<RHYME_209165>, કરજ્યો સેવા કરી બહુ પ્રીત્ય<RHYME_209165>.
gujarati.context: The divine form of Krishna is present, and His devotees are two brothers; they reside in the Lord's words daily and serve with great devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી કૃષ્ણની પ્રતિમા જેહ<RHYME_209166>, આપણે પૂજીએ છીએ તેહ<RHYME_209166>; 
તે આ શ્રીહરિની નિશ્ચે બૂઝજ્યો, એમ જાણી વિધિએ પૂજજ્યો.
gujarati.context: Wherever the idol of Krishna is found, we worship it; that very moment, our devotion to Shri Hari is awakened and fulfilled.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી પ્રથમ તમને મેં પુત્ર<RHYME_209168>, કહ્યા શ્રીકૃષ્ણના જે બે મંત્ર<RHYME_209168>; 
અષ્ટાક્ષર મંત્ર પામ્યા આપ<RHYME_209169>, તે પણ આના જાણી કરો જાપ<RHYME_209169>.
gujarati.context: I have given you a son as your first gift, and I have taught you two mantras of Sri Krishna; the eight-letter mantra has been fulfilled in you, now know it by heart.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
અહિંસાદિક પાળજ્યો નિયમ<RHYME_209170>, રહેજ્યો સ્વધર્મમાં કરી પ્રેમ<RHYME_209170>; 
મારી એટલી આગન્યા ધારી, ભજજ્યો હરિ આ સુખકારી.
gujarati.context: A rule of gentle kindness is to follow one's own nature and cultivate love within the bounds of one's faith. May my soul be purified by the fire of devotion, and may I attain happiness in this life.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ વર્તશો તમે સુજાણ<RHYME_209172>, થાશે તમારાં કોટિ કલ્યાણ<RHYME_209172>; 
એમ વર્તજ્યો બેઉ ભ્રાત<RHYME_209162>, સત્ય માની લેજ્યો મારી વાત<RHYME_209162>.
gujarati.context: You will prosper if you follow my words, with your entire family's well-being ensured; and just like two brothers, believe in the truth I speak.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી શ્રીકૃષ્ણ જે આ અક્રુધ<RHYME_209173>, શસ્ત્ર લઈ નહિ કરે યુધ<RHYME_209173>; 
નિજબુદ્ધિએ કરી દયાળ<RHYME_209174>, કરશે અસુર જનનો કાળ<RHYME_209174>.
gujarati.context: Lord Krishna, who is merciful and does not take up arms in war; with his wisdom, He will bring about the end of the demon's era.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
કળી અધર્મથી વધ્યા ઘણા, વેશ લઈ રહ્યા મનુષ્ય તણા; 
તે પૃથ્વીએ લોપાવી સ્વધર્મ<RHYME_209176>, પાપી કરાવે છે જે કુકર્મ<RHYME_209176>.
gujarati.context: Many people have exceeded their moral boundaries and are now wearing a false pretence; on this earth, they've lost their true nature and instead do evil deeds that bring them karma.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે અધર્મ ટળાવશે સહુ, કૃષ્ણભક્તિ કરાવશે બહુ; 
કરશે અલૌકિક બહુ કાજ<RHYME_209177>, પછી વિચારીને વર્ણીરાજ<RHYME_209177>.
gujarati.context: God's law will be broken if we follow unrighteous paths, but through devotion to Krishna, many great things will be achieved. Later, we'll learn and narrate our experiences.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
નિજ આચારજ પદ જેહ<RHYME_209166>, સ્થાપશે તમારે કુળે તેહ<RHYME_209166>; 
એમ કરી મોટાં મોટાં કામ<RHYME_209178>, પછી પધારશે નિજધામ<RHYME_209178>.
gujarati.context: Do what is necessary for your family's prosperity, and later you will attain your own spiritual growth.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે હરિ આશ્રિત જે જન<RHYME_209160>, તેને ધીરજ્ય નહિ રહે મન<RHYME_209160>; 
બહુ બહુ કરશે તે શોક<RHYME_209179>, કહેશે પ્રભુજી ગયા ગોલોક<RHYME_209179>.
gujarati.context: Those who rely on God's protection will not experience fear or worry; instead, they will suffer grief and cry out to the Lord saying "Prabhu ji" has gone to Golok (heaven).
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
થાશે નિરાધાર ને નિરાશ, ત્યારે ઉરમાં વિચારી દાસ; 
પછી શ્રીહરિની જે પ્રતિમા, કરશે પૂજાભાવ લાવી તેમાં.
gujarati.context: When hopelessness settles in and there's no escape, think of your inner self; then you'll worship the divine image within you.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી મર્યાદા બાંધશે તેહ<RHYME_209166>, તેમાં જન રહેશે નિમે જેહ<RHYME_209166>; 
એની મૂર્તિના જે પૂજનારા, એવા ભક્ત જગતથી ન્યારા.
gujarati.context: Those who set limits for themselves will be saved in that very limit; and those who worship the formless God are freed from worldly bondage.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેહ ધર્મ અર્થ મોક્ષ કામ<RHYME_209178>, પામે જાણો પુરુષ ને વામ<RHYME_209178>; 
એમાં નથી સંદેહ લગાર<RHYME_209181>, નિશ્ચય માનો કરી નિરધાર<RHYME_209181>.
gujarati.context: This couplet suggests that a person should prioritize the four goals of human life - dharma, artha, kama, and moksha - and not waver in their pursuit of these goals, but rather have unwavering conviction and determination.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવી તાતની સાંભળી વાત<RHYME_209162>, ભાઈ બેઉ થયા રળિયાત<RHYME_209162>; 
પછી લાગ્યા છે હરિને પાય<RHYME_209159>, અમે તમારા છું વર્ણીરાય<RHYME_209159>.
gujarati.context: Listen to the story with patience, brother; later it will reach God's feet, and we will have written your fate.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
સર્વે કાળે કરો રક્ષા મારી, ત્યારે ભાઈ પ્રત્યે કહે મુરારી; 
તમે આદરે ભજો શ્રીકૃષ્ણ<RHYME_209183>, તેણે કરી હું થાઈશ પ્રષ્ણ<RHYME_209183>.
gujarati.context: At the end of all time, I will seek protection with you, then brother, Murari; you should worship Lord Krishna, and He will grant me eternal life, Prashn.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
આપણે તાતે કરી આગન્યા, તમારે ન કરવું તે વિના; 
એવી સુણી બેઉ ભાઈએ વાણી, ભજ્યા શ્રીહરિને કૃષ્ણ જાણી.
gujarati.context: We did what we wanted, and you shouldn't do it either; such is the way of brothers who follow the Vani, worshipping Srihari as Krishna knows well.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
પણ પ્રત્યક્ષ હરિનું ધ્યાન<RHYME_209186>, રહ્યું હરિ ઇચ્છામાં નિદાન<RHYME_209186>; 
કેદિ થાય ને કેદિ ન થાય<RHYME_209187>, એવી રીતે વરતે સદાય<RHYME_209187>.
gujarati.context: God's direct attention is the ultimate goal; one should surrender to His will, neither resisting nor craving anything, and thus live eternally.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ ધર્મે તેડી સુત બેને, કર્યો ઉપદેશ તેહ તેને; 
એકાદશી નિશિ રહેતાં જામ<RHYME_209163>, જપે મંત્ર જેમાં શ્રીકૃષ્ણનામ<RHYME_209163>.
gujarati.context: This couplet suggests that one should follow the teachings of their faith (Dharma) and seek guidance from God, specifically Lord Krishna's name in the process. The reference to midnight (Ekaadashi Nish) implies a connection to spiritual practices and devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાં તો સૂર્ય તણું ઉદય થયું, ભાઈ સાંભળતાં નાથે કહ્યું; 
હે તાત જે અભીષ્ટ તમારે, હોય તે કહો કરવું મારે.
gujarati.context: Where the sun rises, I rose too; My brother didn't listen, so I told him to do what he wanted to do.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે ધર્મ કહે સુણો હરિ, પૂર્ણકામ છઉં નિશ્ચયે કરી; 
પણ શ્રીકૃષ્ણ ભક્તિની તૃપતિ, તે તો મારે મને નથી થાતી.
gujarati.context: Religiosity says follow God's path, but I'm convinced that only devotion to Lord Krishna fulfills my soul.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે દેહ પડ્યા સુધી ભક્તિ, કરવાને ઇચ્છું છું હું અતિ; 
થયું અશક્ત દેહ આ મારું, નથી થાતું તે પૂજન બારું.
gujarati.context: I yearn to dedicate my entire being to devotion; I want to surrender myself, even if it means a broken body.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે સાત દિવસમાં સુત<RHYME_209195>, અર્થ સહિત સુણાવો ભાગવત<RHYME_209195>; 
એવી સાંભળી તાતની વાણી, તેને મહારાજે બહુ વખાણી.
gujarati.context: The couplet advises to understand the true meaning and essence of the Bhagavad Gita within seven days, without fail; and one should listen carefully to the divine voice, praised by great rulers.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી મંડપ કર્યો સુબુદ્ધ<RHYME_209196>, તેડ્યો બ્રાહ્મણ વૈષ્ણવી શુદ્ધ<RHYME_209196>; 
શ્રીમદ્‍ભાગવતનો ભણેલો, તેને તેડાવિયો ઘેર્ય વહેલો.
gujarati.context: The temple of the soul is purified, and one becomes a true Vaishnavi Brahmin; having learned from Bhagvata's teachings, they are surrounded by divine love.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
યથા વિધિએ પૂજ્યા શ્રીકૃષ્ણ<RHYME_209183>, કથા પ્રારંભી દ્વાદશી દિન; 
તે દિ થકી ધર્મે તે વિચારી, હરિ મૂરતિમાં વૃત્તિ ધારી.
gujarati.context: As per divine guidance, Sri Krishna's story began on the twelfth day; then, considering the faith, He took a vow of devotion in His heart.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
જેને સમીપે આવે જ મરવું, તેને ઘટિત છે એમ કરવું; 
કથા સાંભળી પામ્યા આનંદ<RHYME_209199>, તેણે જ્વર પીડા પડી મંદ<RHYME_209199>.
gujarati.context: The one who gets close to death should be careful; the story of happiness has fever and is becoming dull.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
સુણે દિવસમાં કથા કાને, રહે રાત્રિમાં સમાધિ ધ્યાને; 
એમ થયા છો દિન તે વાર<RHYME_209201>, થયું સાતમે દિને સવાર<RHYME_209201>.
gujarati.context: During the day, thoughts are scattered and busy; at night, the mind is focused on contemplation. The cycle repeats daily, with the morning sunrise bringing a new dawn to focus on spiritual pursuits.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
તિથિ ચોથ્ય ને શુકરવારે, સુણિ કથા સંપૂરણ તારે; 
કરી કથા તણી સમાપતિ, આપ્યાં બ્રાહ્મણને દાન અતિ.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a sacred moment when the story reaches its climax, and a generous Brahmin offers a great gift. The narrative is complete, and the reward is substantial.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
વસ્ત્ર ભૂષણ દક્ષિણા દીધી, કરી પૂજા પછી રૂડી વિધિ; 
પછી બ્રાહ્મણ વળાવ્યો ઘેર્ય<RHYME_209203>, વળતા વિપ્ર જમ્યા રૂડી પેર્ય<RHYME_209203>.
gujarati.context: The devotee has worshipped God with a pure heart, and after that, they have reached the stage of being detached from worldly pleasures; they have been freed by the Brahmin's (spiritual guide) words, like one who is freed from a debt.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાં તો દિવસ ચડિયો પહોર<RHYME_209204>, ધર્મતને જ્વરે કર્યું જોર<RHYME_209204>; 
ત્યારે ધર્મે સ્વજન તેડાવ્યાં, જોખનાદિક જમીને આવ્યા.
gujarati.context: There is no time for idle chatter when one's faith is tested with a fever, and even the earth trembles in response. When faith is put to the test, one's own family and community come together in support.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
બેઠા સમીપે આવી સ્વજન<RHYME_209205>, ત્યાં તો દીઠું છે શિથિલ તન<RHYME_209205>; 
વિચારીને સુતે વાત લીધી, તેડી વિપ્ર ક્રિયા સર્વે કીધી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

When a dear friend comes close to sit, my thoughts are always with myself; I have taken care of all concerns and worries in my mind.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધર્મશાસ્ત્રે વિધિ કહ્યો જેહ<RHYME_209166>, ઘટે તેમ કરાવિયો તેહ<RHYME_209166>; 
વળી બ્રાહ્મણ તેડી હજારું, આપ્યું કાચું અન્ન ઘૃત સારું.
gujarati.context:
According to sacred texts, do as the situation demands; 
In worldly matters, a Brahmin's conduct should be simple and pure.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
આપી ધેનુ તણાં દાન વળી, પછી બેઠા ધર્મ પાસે મળી; 
ચાલ્યો એકદંડો શ્વાસ જાણી, નવરાવ્યા તીરથને પાણી.
gujarati.context: As one gives their all to others, they will eventually find faith and devotion by themselves; when a person's breath leaves their body, the unfulfilled desires are left behind like an arrow without water.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ગઉછાણે લીંપી ભૂમિ સાર<RHYME_209201>, તે ઉપર્ય [બેસાર્યા] તે વાર<RHYME_209201>; 
પછી પાસળે હતાં જે જન<RHYME_209160>, કરવા લાગ્યાં શ્રીકૃષ્ણ ભજન<RHYME_209160>.
gujarati.context: After a tumultuous life, one finds peace; then they start worshiping Lord Krishna with devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધર્મ પોતે તો હરિને જોઈ<RHYME_209209>, થયાં સ્થિર તેમાં દ્રગ દોઈ<RHYME_209209>; 
અનન્ય ભાવ એવા ધર્મદેવ<RHYME_209210>, તેણે તજ્યું તન તતખેવ<RHYME_209210>.
gujarati.context: The self-realized soul finds God in their own being and remains steady; they experience the ultimate joy and peace that is beyond worldly attachments.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ શ્રીકૃષ્ણને પરતાપે, છૂટ્યા ઋષિના શાપથી આપે; 
પછી ભક્તિ આદિ દઈ જેહ<RHYME_209166>, સર્વે સંબંધી કહેવાય તેહ<RHYME_209166>.
gujarati.context: Lord Krishna's deliverance was the result of the sage's curse; afterwards, everything connected to devotion is considered sacred.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
પુત્રરૂપ હરિની સેવાયે, રહ્યા હરિ સમીપે સદાયે; 
પછી નાથ બંધવને કાવી, ક્રિયા તાતની સર્વે કરાવી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

One's true form is serving God, and one should always remain near God; afterwards, one can bind their actions with devotion, bringing joy to their soul.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધર્મશાસ્ત્રમાં જે વિધિ કહ્યો, દાહાદિક તેમ પૂરો થયો; 
સર્વે સંબંધી ઘરનાં જન<RHYME_209160>, શોકાતુર કરે છે રુદન<RHYME_209160>.
gujarati.context: The moral code set forth in scriptures is fully realized; it is the householders' duty to mourn and lament.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:
કર્યાં શ્રાદ્ધ તે તેરમા સુધી, જમાડ્યા બ્રાહ્મણ ભલી વિધિ; 
પછી શ્રવણી થઈ જાણી જન<RHYME_209160>, લાવ્યા વસ્ત્ર ઘરેણાં ને ધન<RHYME_209160>.
gujarati.context: The ritualistic duties (shraddha) performed by a person will benefit them up to the grave, and after that, their relatives will learn from it and receive the rewards of their good deeds. Their wealth and clothes will be inherited by those who are grateful for the blessings received.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૨૬: ધર્મદેહત્યાગ ને શ્રીહરિ ઘેરથી નિસર્યા
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 26: Dharma-deh-tyāg ne Shrī Hari Gherthī Nisaryā

gujarati.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

Hari upāsī janne, chhe sāmbhaḷtā sukhrūp.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one's spiritual journey (Sarve maḷī) is filled with obstacles, but ultimately leads to joy and happiness. The path of devotion to God (Hari upāsī) brings great bliss and satisfaction.

transliteration.couplet:

Amṛutvat kathā eh, sadmati suṇashe sahu.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of the life story being unfolded step by step, with Lord Krishna's divine presence in abundance. It is a precious and sacred tale that should be listened to with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Vachan chhe Dharmadevnā, putra pratye paramāṇ; <RHYME_3>
Shravaṇ daī je sāmbhaḷe, te pāme pad niravāṇ.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The righteous one is a treasure trove of virtues, and his son inherits his good qualities as a result. Those who listen to him with devotion will gain spiritual enlightenment in return.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī dharme sut teḍāviyā, devā shikhāmaṇ sukhkāj; <RHYME_4>
Ant same nidhi āpavā, ichhyā āpe Mahārāj.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The couplet advises to follow one's own faith and not worry about others' opinions, as it brings happiness and peace; and if one seeks spiritual wealth, they should approach their true Lord, the Supreme.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī teḍāviyā sut doy, āvī beṭhā vandan karī soy; <RHYME_5>
Jyāre putra lāgyā āvī pāy, teh pratye bolyā Dharmarāy.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: As the son grows up and leaves, he must bow down to his parents' doorstep; Just like Dharmaraj, the god of justice, gives rewards to those who are deserving.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The child listens to the father's words of wisdom, which are precious and beneficial for his soul. The secrets of life can only be understood by opening one's heart and cultivating love.

transliteration.couplet:

Tyāre kar joḍī kahe beu bhrāta, ame mānashun kaho tame tāta.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: A person's word is considered sacred and respected, and if broken, it will leave a lasting stain. The brother asks what to do when someone breaks their promise, and the response is that one should say "that's enough" to them.

transliteration.couplet:
Je je kahesho ā same vachan, te te satya mānavā chhe man; <RHYME_8>

transliteration.context: When one says "yes" with conviction, it is true of a noble person; Rādhā and Kṛuṣhṇa are the ultimate example of this self-truth.

transliteration.couplet:
Jene upāsu chhu āṭhu jām, te ja Kṛuṣhṇa ā Shrī Hari nām; <RHYME_9>
Mārā sut ne tamārā bhāī, te chhe Kṛuṣhṇa māno man māī.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: Even a small amount of devotion to Lord Krishna is sufficient; having him as the ultimate goal in life makes all other relationships seem like siblings.

transliteration.couplet:
Harirūp ā Kṛuṣhṇa sākṣhāt, tenī bhakti karajyo be bhrāt; <RHYME_10>
Rahejyo enā vachanmā nitya, karajyo sevā karī bahu prītya.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary:

Cultivate devotion to God with full sincerity and dedication, just as you would for your brother. Always remember His words daily and serve Him with love and enthusiasm.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī Kṛuṣhṇanī pratimā jeh, āpaṇe pūjīe chhīe teh; <RHYME_11>
Te ā Shrī Harinī nishche būzajyo, em jāṇī vidhie pūjajyo.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: Worshiping a figurine of Krishna's divine form is mere pretence; instead, understand and worship the true nature of God as taught by Shri Hari.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī pratham tamane me putra, kahyā Shrī Kṛuṣhṇanā je be mantra; <RHYME_12>
Aṣhṭākṣhar mantra pāmyā āp, te paṇ ānā jāṇī karo jāp.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should first invoke Lord Krishna's name and then recite the Aṣhṭākṣhar mantra with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Ahinsādik pāḷajyo niyam, rahejyo swadharmamā karī prem; <RHYME_13>
Mārī eṭalī āganyā dhārī, bhajajyo Hari ā sukhkārī.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context:
Non-violence is a natural rule, and one should follow their own duty with love; 

One should perform their duties with devotion to the Lord, remaining in peace.

transliteration.couplet:
Em vartasho tame sujāṇ, thāshe tamārā koṭi kalyāṇ; <RHYME_14>
Em vartajyo beu bhrāt, satya mānī lejyo mārī vāt.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context:
When fate is kind to you, it brings countless good times; when fate is cruel, your own brother can bring about a stormy wind.

(Note: This summarization attempts to capture the essence of the couplet's rhyme scheme and poetic tone.)

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī Shrī Kṛuṣhṇa je ā akrudh, shastra laī nahi kare yudh; <RHYME_15>
Nij-buddhie karī dayāḷ, karashe asur janno kāḷ.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: Krishna's compassion is not based on scriptural teachings, but rather arises from his own inner wisdom; he shows mercy to even the wicked souls.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaḷī adharmathī vadhyā ghaṇā, vesh laī rahyā manuṣhya taṇā; <RHYME_16>
Te pṛuthvīe lopāvī swadharma, pāpī karāve chhe je kukarma.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: One who follows an immoral path is considered a wicked person, and such a being is destroyed by their own actions. The earth punishes those who abandon their dharma and instead do evil deeds.

transliteration.couplet:
Te adharma ṭaḷāvashe sahu, Kṛuṣhṇa-bhakti karāvashe bahu; <RHYME_17>
Karashe alaukik bahu kāj, pachhī vichārīne Varṇīrāj.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: In a state of chaos and disorder (Te adharma), many follow the path of devotion to Krishna; meanwhile, countless ordinary tasks are left undone, while one seeks divine knowledge (pachhī vichārīne).

transliteration.couplet:
Nij āchāraj pad jeh, sthāpashe tamāre kuḷe teh; <RHYME_18>
Em karī moṭā moṭā kām, pachhī padhārashe nijdhām.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the concept of finding one's own spiritual path and staying on it, free from external influences. It emphasizes the importance of individual dedication and not getting distracted by others' opinions or expectations.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre Hari āshrit je jan, tene dhīrajya nahi rahe man; <RHYME_19>
Bahu bahu karashe te shok, kaheshe Prabhujī gayā Golok.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context:
Those who are devoted to God, their courage and resolution have left their minds; they experience various forms of distress.

Their grief is repeatedly mentioned, as if the Lord has taken them away to the realm of Golok.

transliteration.couplet:
Thāshe nirādhār ne nirāsh, tyāre urmā vichārī dās; <RHYME_20>
Pachhī Shrī Harinī je pratimā, karashe pūjābhāv lāvī temā.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: One who has lost their foundation is without hope, and in vain will they ponder the depths of the sea. The form of Sri Hari's beloved one is far away, making worship impossible at this moment.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī maryādā bāndhashe teh, temā jan raheshe nime jeh; <RHYME_21>
Enī mūrtinā je pūjanārā, evā bhakta jagatthī nyārā.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: The devotee is bound by the limits of time and space, yet their devotion transcends these boundaries. Just as a worshipper's soul merges with the divine form they adore, so too does the devotee's love for God reach out to the entire universe.

transliteration.couplet:
Teh dharma arth mokṣh kām, pāme jāṇo puruṣh ne vām; <RHYME_22>
Emā nathī sandeh lagār, nishchay māno karī nirdhār.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that a person should strive for dharma (righteousness), artha (wealth), moksha (liberation), and kama (pleasure) with unwavering determination, without doubt or hesitation. One must decide with conviction and then move forward steadfastly.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī tātnī sāmbhaḷī vāt, bhāī beu thayā raḷiyāt; <RHYME_23>
Pachhī lāgyā chhe Harine pāy, ame tamārā chhu Varṇīrāy.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: A strong gust of wind blows, my brother's words have fallen silent; But I still remember the words spoken by the Lord, they are mine to recite.

transliteration.couplet:
Sarve kāḷe karo rakṣhā mārī, tyāre bhāī pratye kahe Murārī; <RHYME_24>
Tame ādare bhajo Shrī Kṛuṣhṇa, teṇe karī hu thāīsh praṣhṇa.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: Protect your karma with all your might, and after that, Murari will tell the story of your brother's fall. Devote yourself to Lord Krishna in your home, and He will relieve you from the burden of your past.

transliteration.couplet:
Āpaṇe tāte karī āganyā, tamāre na karavu te vinā; <RHYME_25>
Evī suṇī beu bhāīe vāṇī, bhajyā Shrī Harine Kṛuṣhṇa jāṇī.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: The soul is burning with passion for someone else, but it cannot be extinguished without achieving union with the Lord; only then will I hear the sweet words of my brother's voice and realize that everything belongs to Lord Krishna.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṇ pratyakṣh Harinu dhyān, rahyu Hari ichchhāmā nidān; <RHYME_26>
Kedi thāy ne kedi na thāy, evī rīte varate sadāy.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: The couplet encourages meditation on God's presence and following one's chosen path in life. It emphasizes the importance of setting a goal and staying committed to it.

transliteration.couplet:
Em Dharme teḍī sut bene, karyo updesh teh tene; <RHYME_27>
Ekādashī nishi rahetā jām, jape mantra jemā Shrī Kṛuṣhṇa-nām.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context:
In righteousness, one's own soul is benefited, and guidance comes from within; 
At night, one should stay awake reciting the name of Lord Krishna, repeating His mantra.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyā to sūrya taṇu uday thayu, bhāī sāmbhaḷtā nāthe kahyu; <RHYME_28>
He tāt je abhīṣhṭ tamāre, hoy te kaho karavu māre.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: A brother is hesitant to tell his sibling's faults, just as the sun rises high but does not reveal its own darkness. The one who has a desire should speak up and eliminate the flaws, rather than hiding them.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre Dharma kahe suṇo Hari, pūrṇakām chhau nishchaye karī; <RHYME_29>
Paṇ Shrī Kṛuṣhṇa bhaktinī tṛupati, te to māre mane nathī thātī.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: Hear the will of God, Sri Krishna's devotee should listen and surrender; one who has love for Him, does not worry about their future.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe deh paḍyā sudhī bhakti, karavāne ichchhu chhu hu ati; <RHYME_30>
Thayu ashakta deh ā māru, nathī thātu te pūjan bāru.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The devotee's body is filled with spiritual longing and devotion, yearning to merge with the divine; their soul is restless, seeking only to worship the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe sāt divasmā sut, arth sahit suṇāvo Bhāgwat; <RHYME_31>
Evī sāmbhaḷī tātnī vāṇī, tene Mahārāje bahu vakhāṇī.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The summary is: A son's devotion to his father lasts for seven days, but the true meaning of the Bhagavad Gita is understood when one listens with a wise king's many words.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī manḍap karyo subuddha, teḍyo brāhmaṇ Vaiṣhṇavī shuddha; <RHYME_32>
Shrīmad-Bhāgwatno bhaṇelo, tene teḍāviyo gherya vahelo.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The devotee who has purified their mind and soul is considered a true Brahmin, pure Vaisnavite. The Lord's glory is sung through the Bhagavat Purana, which carries us across the ocean of worldly existence.

transliteration.couplet:
Yathā vidhie pūjyā Shrī Kṛuṣhṇa, kathā prārambhī dvādashī din; <RHYME_33>
Te di thakī Dharme te vichārī, Hari mūratimā vṛutti dhārī.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: Worship Lord Krishna in the same way you would a dear friend, and for twelve days straight; then only consider righteousness and live life with devotion to God's form.

transliteration.couplet:
Jene samīpe āve ja maravu, tene ghaṭit chhe em karavu; <RHYME_34>
Kathā sāmbhaḷī pāmyā ānand, teṇe jvar pīḍā paḍī mand.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: In the warmth of love, my heart beats fast, and in its absence, I'm left with a bitter taste. The story of separation is a tale of sorrow, leaving only longing in its wake.

transliteration.couplet:
Suṇe divasmā kathā kāne, rahe rātrimā samādhi dhyāne; <RHYME_35>
Em thayā chho din te vār, thayu sātame dine savār.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: Listen to the story of the day and meditate at night, and you will achieve your goals in a few days or months.

transliteration.couplet:
Tithi chothya ne Shukarvāre, suṇi kathā sampūraṇ tāre; <RHYME_36>
Karī kathā taṇī samāpati, āpyā brāhmaṇne dān ati.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a joyful occasion where people gather to hear the story of a devotee's love for God, and it is pleasing to both the listener and the speaker. The story brings joy and satisfaction, and even the Brahmin gets more than just their due share.

transliteration.couplet:
Vastra bhūṣhaṇ dakṣhiṇā dīdhī, karī pūjā pachhī rūḍī vidhi; <RHYME_37>
Pachhī brāhmaṇ vaḷāvyo gherya, vaḷatā vipra jamyā rūḍī perya.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: A person's wealth and reputation are wasted if not properly utilized after retirement, just like a Brahmin's sacred thread is worn out if not maintained.

transliteration.couplet:

Tyāre Dharme swajan teḍāvyā, jokhanādik jamīne āvyā.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: In the evening of life, one should hasten their spiritual endeavors with all vigor and might. In the realm of dharma, one's own self is the true companion that will accompany them to the end of time.

transliteration.couplet:
Beṭhā samīpe āvī swajan, tyā to dīṭhu chhe shithil tan; <RHYME_39>
Vichārīne sute vāt līdhī, teḍī vipra kriyā sarve kīdhī.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The couple is surrounded by their own family, like a tree rooted in its place; they don't get shaken or wavered. In their thoughts, they should not let others' opinions sway them, but instead follow their own path with conviction and action.

transliteration.couplet:
Dharmashāstre vidhi kahyo jeh, ghaṭe tem karāviyo teh; <RHYME_40>
Vaḷī brāhmaṇ teḍī hajāru, āpyu kāchu anna ghṛut sāru.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: According to tradition and custom, one should follow the rules; and in times of crisis, take refuge in devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Āpī dhenu taṇā dān vaḷī, pachhī beṭhā Dharma pāse maḷī; <RHYME_41>
Chālyo ekdanḍo shvās jāṇī, navarāvyā tīrathne pāṇī.  <RHYME_41>

Give your wealth to others, and achieve salvation at the end of life; take one breath at a time and drink from the ocean of devotion.

transliteration.couplet:

Pachhī pāsaḷe hatā je jan, karavā lāgyā Shrī Kṛuṣhṇa bhajan.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a humble person who has gained spiritual understanding on the ground of devotion to Lord Krishna, and this understanding will take them far in their spiritual journey.

transliteration.couplet:
Dharma pote to Harine joī, thayā sthir temā drag doī; <RHYME_43>

transliteration.context: The couplet emphasizes the importance of following one's duty (dharma) and being steadfast in it, as it is the foundation of a peaceful life. It also suggests that one should not be swayed by external influences or desires, but rather remain true to their inner nature.

transliteration.couplet:
Em Shrī Kṛuṣhṇane paratāpe, chhūṭyā ṛuṣhinā shāpthī āpe; <RHYME_44>
Pachhī bhakti ādi daī jeh, sarve sambandhī kahevāy teh.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: In the presence of Lord Krishna, all worldly attachments are cut off and destroyed. All relationships and connections with others are severed in the pursuit of devotion to Him.

transliteration.couplet:

Pachhī Nāth bandhavane kāvī, kriyā tātnī sarve karāvī.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: Serving one's children is serving God himself, as they should always remain in His presence. In the afterlife, one's deeds done for their friends will be rewarded.

transliteration.couplet:

Sarve sambandhī gharnā jan, shokātur kare chhe rudan.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context:
According to the scriptures, one should follow the rules and fulfill their duties; otherwise, sorrow will befall them like a fire that consumes everything.

All relationships are like a house, but grief can enter and cause tears.

transliteration.couplet:
Karyā shrāddha te termā sudhī, jamāḍyā brāhmaṇ bhalī vidhi; <RHYME_47>
Pachhī shravaṇī thaī jāṇī jan, lāvyā vastra ghareṇā ne dhan.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The couplet advises to perform the last rites and give offerings with faith, just like a Brahmin priest would conduct the rituals properly. After listening to the sacred story, one should take home the knowledge and treasures, not mere clothes or wealth.

transliteration.couplet:
Āpī Rāmpratāpne teh, gayā sau saune gherya eh; <RHYME_48>
Rāmpratāp ne Ichchhārām, jape mantra raṭe Kṛuṣhṇanām.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: Lord Rāmpratāp's heart is filled with devotion, as he chants mantras at night to please Lord Krishna. His soul is pure and focused on spiritual growth.

transliteration.couplet:
Nij bhāīmā Shrī Kṛuṣhṇabhāv, rākhe sadāy karī uchhāv; <RHYME_49>
Hari pote ati nispreh, jene koyshu nathī saneh.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

Lord Krishna's love for his devotee is forever unshakeable and always elevates him; Only those who have true devotion to God can find solace in His presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Pote rahyātā gherya je vāte, thaī pūrī tajyu tan tāte; <RHYME_50>
Vaḷato karyo chhe bījo vichār, karavā anek jīv uddhār.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should not worry about the future (Pote rahyātā) and instead focus on living in the present moment (thaī pūrī tajyu tan tāte). It also emphasizes the importance of thinking carefully before taking action, as it can greatly benefit or harm many lives.

transliteration.couplet:

Samvat aḍhār ogaṇ pachās, varte varṣhamā Aṣhāḍh mās.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: In the presence of God, Ghanshyam is humble and waits patiently; In Samvat era, it's the 15th year, in the month of Ashadha.

transliteration.couplet:
Sudī dashamī Shukarvār, te di Prabhujī thayā taiyār; <RHYME_52>
Prātahkāḷe chālyā nāvā miṣhe, tyāthī shuddha uttarnī dishe.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: On Fridays, the Lord is prepared for worship; In the morning, one should go to the temple and see the pure goddess above.

transliteration.couplet:
Ghar parathī utaryu man, vahālu lāge chhe vasavu van; <RHYME_53>
Ek kopīn ne āchchhādan, te vinā bīju nathī vasan.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: A person's home is where they truly feel happy and peaceful, like a cowherd in his natural habitat. But without effort and hard work, one cannot even cultivate a small herb in life.

transliteration.couplet:
Mṛugchhālā ne tulasī māḷ, urdhvapunḍra chihna chhe vishāḷ; <RHYME_54>
Jaṭā mukuṭ manḍit māthe, līdho palāshno danḍ hāthe.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context: The morning sun's gentle rays adorn the tulsi plant; above it, a subtle beauty is hidden in its fragrance. The crown on the head of the lotus flower is decorated with the gemstone of love, and the palm leaf in hand holds the fruit of wisdom.

transliteration.couplet:
Chāre shāstra taṇu jeh sār, tenu pustak khabhā mozār; <RHYME_55>
Munji mekhalā kamanḍalu kar, pāse bhikṣhānu pātra sundar.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: The true essence of a scripture is in its practical application, not just book learning. One should strive to achieve the beauty of simplicity in their actions and offerings.

transliteration.couplet:
Bāḷmukund ne Shālgrām, bāndhyo kanṭhe baṭavo te Shyām; <RHYME_56>
Evā thakā Sarajūne tīr, āvyā ūtarvā nadī nīr.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the love between two souls, Balmukund and Shyam, as strong as a stone (Shalgram) tied around their necks. The poet compares this unbreakable bond to a river that flows endlessly, never losing its strength or depth.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī juve chhe vāṇnī vāṭ, tarta nadī ūtarvā māṭ; <RHYME_57>
Biye manuṣhya āvatā bhāḷī, jāṇe rakhe jāy pāchhā vāḷī.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a beautiful lotus flower blooming in the river's bend, with its beauty preserved for all to enjoy. Similarly, a human being's life (or legacy) blooms in their lifetime, leaving behind a lasting impression for others to remember.

transliteration.couplet:
Eve same āvyo chhe asur, jāṇyu maḷiyo vairī jarūr; <RHYME_58>
Teṇe gaḍathlāvī gaḷe zālī, nākhī pūrmā nisaryo chālī.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the characteristics of a wicked person who will surely be defeated; they may initially pretend to be good, but their true nature will ultimately be exposed. Their evil deeds will eventually catch up with them and they will face defeat.

transliteration.couplet:
Jaḷ agādh athāh vahe, je paḍe te jīvato na rahe; <RHYME_59>
Moṭā maghar machchha chhe jemā, jaḷghoḍā kātraṇiyo temā.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context: When troubles pile up, one's life is in danger; and when the ocean of misfortune surges forward, even a small fish can't survive.

transliteration.couplet:
Jaḷsāp ne krachalā kaī, maghariyo rahyā doṭu daī; <RHYME_60>
Jemā zūḍyu jaḷoyu chitaḷyu, mele nahi nānu moṭu maḷyu.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy of getting married and starting a new life together, where love and togetherness reign supreme. It celebrates the happiness of being with one's partner in every moment, big or small.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā jaḷ-jantu dukhkārī, vahe nīr bhayānak bhārī; <RHYME_61>
Ūṭhe leryo bhramariyo vaḷe, māhi loḍh moṭā te ūchhaḷe.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context: Life is a heavy burden like a weight on the back of an elephant, and one's soul is filled with fear. The darkness of ignorance is like a buzzing mosquito that torments us all the time.

transliteration.couplet:
Chāle prachanḍ vegmā pūr, temā nākhīne chālyo asur; <RHYME_62>
Dīṭhā dūr lagī to taṇāṇā, pachhī duṣhṭane naiv dekhāṇā.  <RHYME_62>
transliteration.context: As one travels far and wide, one should not indulge in evil deeds; if one's path is blocked, then look back and see what mistakes were made.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre pāpīe em pramāṇyu, muvo vairī nishche man jāṇyu; <RHYME_63>
Pachhī daitya gayo nijdhām, kahe karī āvyo moṭu kām.  <RHYME_63>
transliteration.context: The couplet advises to measure one's own shortcomings before judging others' mistakes. One should focus on their own flaws and not get carried away by the vices of others.

transliteration.couplet:
Vairī māryo kahī evī vāt, tyāre asur thayā raḷiyāt; <RHYME_64>
Have Hari paḍyā chhe je pūre, te to nisariyā jaī dūre.  <RHYME_64>
transliteration.context: The wind of separation blows strongly from somewhere, and those who don't have God's shelter will wander far away. Those who are complete with Hari (God) won't be affected by this distance.

transliteration.couplet:
Traṇ pahor rahyā jaḷ māī, bār gāu nisaryā taṇāī; <RHYME_65>
Pūjā pustak pāsaḷe rahyu, bīju sarave taṇāī gayu.  <RHYME_65>
transliteration.context: The mother's heart remains heavy as the tree's branches remain entwined. Just like books and seeds require nourishment to grow, so too does love in the family flourish.

transliteration.couplet:
Em nisariyā jyāre Nāth, chālyā ekalā nahi bīju sāth; <RHYME_66>
Līdhī kāḷā parvatnī vāṭ, saune visārīne Varaṇīrāṭ.  <RHYME_66>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The Lord (Nath) doesn't go anywhere without me; He has taken a vow to be with me always.

He has made Mount Varanasi, his abode, and remains there with me forever.

transliteration.couplet:
Paḍī sānj ne āthamyo din, āvyu ghor vikaṭ tyā van; <RHYME_67>
Rahyā rātya te van mozār, nathī manmā bīk lagār.  <RHYME_67>
transliteration.context: A harsh day has passed, and a fierce night is approaching, with great turmoil in the heart; now it's time to sleep, but worries keep me awake, with no peace of mind.
